      • contextAcquire

        public static JMSCAPI_misc.HCRYPTPROV contextAcquire(java.lang.String container,
                                     java.lang.String provider,
                                     int type,
                                     int flags)
        Simple CryptAcquireContext wrapper. Passes all given params into CryptAcquireContext.
        Parameters:
        container - The key container name.
        NOTE: When flags is set to CRYPT_VERIFYCONTEXT, pszContainer must be set to NULL.

        provider - String that contains the name of the CSP to be used.
        NOTE: If this parameter is NULL, the user default provider of specified type is used.

        type - The type of provider to acquire.

        flags -
        Returns:
        NOTE: When you have finished using the CSP, release the handle by calling contextRelease function.

      • contextAcquire

        public static JMSCAPI_misc.HCRYPTPROV contextAcquire(java.lang.String container,
                                     java.lang.String provider,
                                     int type)
        The contextAcquire function is a "smart" wrapper for CryptAcquireContext function used to acquire a handle to a particular key container within a particular cryptographic service provider (CSP). This returned handle is used in calls to JMSCAPI functions that use the selected CSP. If key container does not exists, it will be created.

        Some CSPs does not exactly follow MSCAPI and does not return NTE_BAD_KEYSET error code when key container does not exist, and even require password for unexisting container. In this function used small workaround to avoid such behavior; it would work with any CSP which correctly responds to a PP_ENUMCONTAINERS flag in CryptGetProvParam function.

        This function first acquires (if it is possible) given CSP`s context, using VerifyContext function, it will be used in order to determine existence of container with given name.
        If name is null or empty String handle received from VerifyContext(Provider, Type) will be returned.

        Then it checks if there is a container with given name, using containerExists function.

        If such key container exist, function acquires and return handle to it, otherwise it creates new container and return handle to newly created container.

        Parameters:
        container - Name of key container.
        May be null or empty String, in such case, function works same as VerifyContext(Provider, Type).
        provider - Provider name.
        May be null if there is only one provider of such type.
        type - The type of provider to acquire.
        Provider types may be learned by calling CryptEnumProviders function.
        Returns:
        A handle to CSP.
        Throws:
        CancelledByUser - when user cancelled CSP`s password request.
        JMSCAPIException

      • contextRelease

        public static void contextRelease(JMSCAPI_misc.HCRYPTPROV hProv)

      • contextVerify

        public static JMSCAPI_misc.HCRYPTPROV contextVerify(java.lang.String provider,
                                    int type)
        This wrapper function of CryptAcquireContext provide access to a CSP with a temporary key container if access to a private key is not required
        Parameters:
        provider - Provider name.
        May be null, if there is only one provider of such type.
        type - The type of provider to acquire.
        Provider types may be learned by calling CryptEnumProviders function.
        Returns:
        A handle to CSP.
        Throws:
        JMSCAPIException - when CryptAcquireContext fails by any reason.

      • hashAddData

        public static void hashAddData(JMSCAPI_misc.HCRYPTHASH hHash,
               java.lang.String data)
        Adds data to a specified hash object. Can be called multiple times to compute the hash of long or discontinuous data streams.

      • hashAddData

        public static void hashAddData(JMSCAPI_misc.HCRYPTHASH hHash,
               byte[] data)
        Adds data to a specified hash object. Can be called multiple times to compute the hash of long or discontinuous data streams. Data field must contain ONLY actual data to be hashed.
